title: Picture-in-picture is wrong in full screen mode
content: When I play a video in picture in picture mode and make it full screen, the backspace button should pause the video, but instead of that it does the last activity (exits the full screen mode). If I press using the mouse the pause/play button, backspace starts working properly too. Please fix the bug where I can not pause/play video while in picture-in-picture mode on full screen. Thanks. Bug occures on every PC so dont ask me for other details. Just reproduce it yourself. (Play a video -> enter picture-in-picture mode -> make it full screen -> press backspace and you'll see it doesn't pause, but it will exit full screen mode which is abnormal)

title: Logging out of Sync with Master Password active
content: Hi! I just wanted to log out from Sync on another machine. I have a master password set. When i want to logout, it asks for the Masterpw. Anyone else thinking, this is bad, from a security point of view? Let's just say, you found a shady site or installed a shady plugin, or someone is shouldersurfing you maybe under pressure. The "Logout and delete everything" would not be possible without giving out your master PW seems a bit awkward.

title: Since firefox 115 (or 114) my skin is also applied to search bar. Any way to undo it?
content:
Since firefox updated to 115 (maybe it was also present in 114 already and I didn't notice) my search bar (which shows when you press ctrl+f) is repeating my skin colors.

I am using this skin currently: https://addons.mozilla.org/pl/firefox/addon/firefox-lightblue/

Before updates this bar was white or beige, just some basic color without skin applied. Now it tries to be one with top bar (it contains bottom half of image from top bar) which makes it harder to read text that is present on it. Were there any changes to how skins work? Skin was not updated since 13.05.2019 so it must be firefox problem. Is there any pref in about config or someplace else to disable applying skin to search bar?

I noticed that on some pages bar is still white. For example on this page it is white. No idea why. On other pages when I open and close them multiple times it is sometimes white sometimes colored...

title: Ghostscript security vulnerabilities (CVE-2023-36664)
content:
Dear Mozilla Support,

Earlier this week we learned about the Ghostscript vulnerability (CVE-2023-36664) and since the security of the systems and data we support is our highest priority, we would like to ensure that the software you provide is not affected by this vulnerability.

Please send us feedback on the following questions no later than 07/27/2023:

1. does Mozilla Firefox use the Ghostscript library with a version older than 10.01.2?

If this is the case, please answer the following questions:

2. is there already a patch, update or plan to fix the problem?

3. if there is or is planned to be a patch, when is it expected to be available and how will users be notified?

4. are there any specific actions or temporary fixes we can take to minimize the risk until a final fix is available?

Thank you in advance for your time and assistance.


Yours sincerely, Hannes Sakuth

Comedia.IT GmbH 20359 Hamburg Germany
creator: hannes.sakuth

title: Firefox 115.0.2 on Linux websites do not appear in dark mode
content: Hi, i am on linux an Firefox 115.0.2. Every supported website appeared in dark mode because of my preferences in the firefox settings respectively about:config layout.css.prefers-color-scheme.content-override is set to 2 and my system mode is dark. (0 and 3 changes nothing) Since some time this settings does not work anymore. The only thing i have changed is: about:config - privacy.trackingprotection.enabled set to true So now all the websites appeared in dark mode now appear in light mode. Chrome shows all these websites in dark mode. (But of course thats no option :-)) An Example: reddit.com: before: dark, now: light mode, Chrome dark mode. So please help! regards, awilli
creator: awilli

title: SSL_ERROR_NO_CYPHER_OVERLAP with archive.is archive.today etc.
content:
The other thread for this https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1219496 is locked and does not contain the correct answer.

The solution: Add the archive sites as exceptions under about:preferences#privacy -> "DNS over HTTPS".
creator: maximiliankohler1

Grazie

title: auto update within about:config
content:
I am looking into why some firefox browsers in my organisation are not auto updating and see some articles mention a setting of app.update.url

I do not have this setting on any of the firefoxes that have the problem or do not have the problem. I do see app.update.url.details set to https://www.mozilla.org/%LOCALE%/firefox/notes and app.update.url.manual set to https://www.mozilla.org/%LOCALE%/firefox/new?reason=manual-update

So is app.update.url needed, if it is, what should its value be or has it been depreciated?

Is there anywhere there is a list of settings for each version of the browser and an explanation of what they do documented anywhere in the same way the Chrome browser has listed at https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/

Regards, Richard.
creator: Hazzie

title: Definitive list of URLs that need to be allowed on a Proxy Server
content:
Hello,

I am looking for a definitive list of URLs that need to be allowed on a Proxy Server for the FireFox browser to Auto Update.

Looking for URLs that the browser uses to see if there is an update available and any other locations where the actual update file is stored.

Regards, Richard.
